<!-- ggplot2 lib
   ggplot(data=<DATA>, mapping=aes(<MAPPING>)) + <GEOM_FUNCTION>()
   
   install.packages("skimr")
   skimr can give a comprehensive summary of dataset
-->
```{r}
library(ggplot2)
mpg  # a dataset
```
```{r}
print("------------------------------glimpse()--------------------------------")
# SUMMARY data by glimpse() function
dplyr::glimpse(mpg)  # use dplyr:: since we did not load the dplyr library 

# Similar to
print("------------------------------str()------------------------------------")
str(mpg)

# Similar to
print("------------------------------summary()--------------------------------")
summary(mpg)
```
```{r}
skimr::skim(mpg)
```
```{r}
mpg$displ
```
```{r}
mpg$hwy
```
```{r}
library(dplyr)
mpg %>%
   select(displ, hwy)
```
```{r}
ggplot(data = mpg,
       mapping = aes(x = displ, y = hwy)) + 
   geom_point()
```
